title: Estimating work done by gas during expansion

content.question: A student heats a sample of gas in a cylinder with a movable piston and a pressure gauge. The student measures the volume and pressure of the gas as the gas is heated. The student’s data is plotted in the graph above. Which of the following gives the best estimate of the work done by the gas on its surroundings during the motion of the piston?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 1. times 10 to the 3 power joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.0</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the 3 power joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="negative 1.1 times 10 to the 4 power joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1.1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="1.1 times 10 to the 4 power joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>1.1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.0 times 10 to the 3 power joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mn>1.0</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
